Joint departments of the Houses of Parliament
	The Corporate Officers may establish joint departments of the Houses ofParliament.
	A joint department has the functions that the Corporate Officers allocateto it from time to time.
	The Corporate Officers may divide, amalgamate or abolish joint departments.
	Their powers in connection with joint departments include power—
		to acquire, hold, manage and dispose of land and other property of anydescription;
		to enter into contracts;
		to do anything reasonably necessary or expedient for or incidental to theirpowers.
	In this Act—
		  * “Corporate Officers” means the Corporate Officer of the House of Commons and the Corporate Officer of the House of Lords; 
		  * “joint department” means a department established under this section. 
Exercise of functions of the Corporate Officers
	The Corporate Officers' functions in connection with joint departments areexercisable by them only jointly.
	Subsection (3) applies to—
		the exercise of functions under section 1(1) or (3);
		the exercise of functions under section 1(2), if it changes the overallcharacter of the services provided by the joint department.
	In those cases—
		the Corporate Officer of the House of Commons may act only with theapproval of the House of Commons Commission;
		the Corporate Officer of the House of Lords may act only in accordance withrecommendations made by the House Committee of the House of Lords and approvedby that House.
	In subsection (3)(b) the reference to the House Committee includes areference to any committee the House of Lords designates instead of thatCommittee for the purposes of this section.
Staff 
	The staff of a joint department are appointed by the Corporate Officers andmust be employed under a contract of employment with them.
	The Corporate Officers must ensure—
		that the pay of staff is kept broadly in line with pay in the Home CivilService;
		that, so far as is consistent with the requirements of both Houses ofParliament, the other conditions of service of staff are kept broadly in linewith those in the Home Civil Service;
		that the pensions and similar benefits of existing and former staff arekept in line with the provisions of the principal Civil Service PensionScheme, as it applies for the time being to the Home Civil Service.
	Subsection (2)(c) does not apply to existing or former staff if provisionfor pensions and similar benefits—
		was made for them under another scheme before they joined the jointdepartment, and
		continues to be made under that scheme in respect of their service in thatdepartment.
Staff transfers
	The Schedule (staff transfers) has effect.
Application of enactments
	An enactment applying in relation to persons employed under a contract ofemployment with the Corporate Officer of the House of Lords applies in thesame way in relation to staff of a joint department.
	For the purposes of any enactment relating to either House of Parliament,anything done by or on behalf of a joint department or in relation to it isdone by or on behalf of each House or in relation to each House (as the casemay be).
	This section applies to enactments whenever passed or made.
Short title
	This Act may be cited as the Parliament (Joint Departments) Act 2007.
